channel.title: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
channel.description:
Like I posted here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,560693.msg4204289.html#msg4204289
Javadocs are here: http://www.projectrsc.com/doc/index.html source code will be published once I have spoken with pompano and had a chance to look if there is anything that needs urgently fixing or w/e and also obv between time spent on prs06
[quote="KO9, post:341, topic:457768"]P.S.: Cannot get on site yet as I need to reset my password in database and honestly I have not slept for 30+ hours I am tired will do it soon...
Here is the current situation.
As many of you are probably aware there are a ton of problems with this server/project. It didn't really take off or go quite how any of us expected and this is really down to a number of things from developers leaving to core staff losing interest and being too busy with personal issues.
The_Berg (The Greens as you may already know) was developing and running the server up until now. He however PM'd me on IRC saying he no longer wants to run the server:
[quote] [08:39:46] <ollie> are you root btw? [08:39:49] <The_Berg> yep [08:39:54] <ollie> can you give me root details? [08:39:57] <ollie> or you not want me to have [08:40:03] <The_Berg> i'll give you the server tbh [08:40:07] <The_Berg> im done running it [08:40:08] <The_Berg> lol [08:40:11] <ollie> why [08:40:14] <ollie> dude [08:40:15] <ollie> no [08:40:15] <The_Berg> ive killed it [08:40:18] <ollie> i can't run the whole thing [08:40:20] <ollie> i can help you [08:40:25] <ollie> but not all of it sorry [08:40:27] <ollie> i don't have time man [08:40:33] <ollie> let me run it with u [08:40:42] <The_Berg> pompano and swo0osh still run it [08:40:45] <ollie> i will lead the project if u want [08:40:47] <ollie> yes [08:40:47] <ollie> obv [08:40:49] <The_Berg> you three can split w/e profits [08:40:53] <The_Berg> i dont want it anymore [08:40:59] <ollie> will you stay dev? [08:41:00] <ollie> head dev [08:41:01] <The_Berg> its not worth the stress and time [08:41:03] <ollie> or? [08:41:22] <The_Berg> i'll admit [08:41:26] <The_Berg> you're one hell of an admin [/quote]
The convo goes on but I tried my best to keep The Berg on board but he really felt his time with the project was up.
I know that I may know have done the best job last time I was running the project however there are also some issues behind like such as issues between staff members and to be blunt I found it hard to command respect and actually have people do what I ask and be informed and kept in the loop about everything. To put it shortly, I didn't feel I was in control or running the project at all.
I am now basically in full control of the project and will just run it how I think is best for the community and server in general. Basically my end goal and vision is to have RSC fully replicated and completed within 6 months! I know that this seems optimistic and I know that this community has seen it and heard it all before about big projects that are going to be amazing and do so much development yet nothing ever comes of it. You guys know me, you guys know my history you may or may not know the work I have done on PRS06 so far in the little time I have had to do it (http://projectrs06.com/) check it out I have been working 18-50 hour days (not shitting to you).
There are a lot of developers asking me to help on projectrs06 and tbh we have a full core dev team and an overflow of devs to work on our open source software (nova, join #prs06code on rizon if interested). I think it would be best for the server, community and everyone (bar maybe rival servers, sorry, maybe we can talk merge or something?) in general if PRSC went fully open source. This includes data files (NOT PLAYER DATA), npc spawns, drop data etc and FULL server source code available to anyone who wants it via a public repo to do as they want. I will add contribs who want to work on the project. I don't care who you are, our history or shit if you have the knowledge, motivation and maturity to work on this project then come by #projectcode on rizon (this will be new prsc public dev chan).
I will be making some changes to the server in the up coming days/weeks as dev team grows (hopefully) and work is done. Give me some time though guys I am very busy with PRS06 right now and have to split time. Great things will come I hope and at the end I really really hope this community ends up with a completed fully working RSC source that I can leave as my legacy.[/quote]

item.title: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:37, topic:478840”][quote=KO9]Basically I am the only person working (at least development wise) on the server right now and I don’t even have the time myself, I really need 2-3 competent people to develop the server under my guidance and I was quite confident that we would get some but so far I’ve not had any serious offers to dev.[/quote]I think actually making it open source would help… How can anyone take you seriously if you don’t even have time to make a private repo public?

Who knows, you may get some people who help here and there or even work on it constantly.[/quote]
This and this…

Read full topic
item.source: Project RSC going open source need developers/help

item.title: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

Basically I am the only person working (at least development wise) on the server right now and I don't even have the time myself, I really need 2-3 competent people to develop the server under my guidance and I was quite confident that we would get some but so far I've not had any serious offers to dev.
I think actually making it open source would help... How can anyone take you seriously if you don't even have time to make a private repo public?

Who knows, you may get some people who help here and there or even work on it constantly.

Read full topic

item.title: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Not_a_bot, post:31, topic:478840”]I don’t follow…you’re saying the DQ plugin system is obsolete yet there’s no actual plugin system in use on any other source at the moment…so how are we calling this “obsolete” (I assume based of time alone)? Yes I understand the meaning of obsolete, but in this field everything goes obsolete in a matter of time, so lets cut the semantics and get specific.[/quote]There being a plugin system in another source also has nothing to do with it. Again, back to the cassette player… It doesn’t matter if you have the most cutting edge cassette player or even the only one, there are CD players, MP3 players, etc.

Naming specifics would take too much time seeing it’s pretty much everything, and you should really name what you think isn’t obsolete.

[quote=“Not_a_bot, post:31, topic:478840”]Anyway, so I quickly browsed the one on MoparClassic (I assume that’s the one you work on). Quickly browsing through, it doesn’t seem completely different to the one on DQ, in fact it just looks like a more organized version of it (feel free to point out if I’ve been looking at the wrong repository (https://github.com/Lothy/MoparClassic/tree/master/GameServer/src/org/moparscape/msc/gs/plugins)). I can also bet there’s not enough testing on it to warrant it even usable yet on production, at least with the DQ version is has been tested out (while not perfect, its usable). Please clarify.[/quote]You’re looking at the wrong branch for one… In addition, Lothy’s repo isn’t the most current. AFAIK this one is: https://github.com/Joe0/MoparClassic

The plugin system you’re referring to is being removed, because it’s a heaping pile of shit. Also, it was something left over from RSCA, and I find it very funny that you think it’s more organized, because it’s older than DQ and PRSCs.

Currently, there are two types of ‘plugins’:

GitHub

Joe0/MoparClassic

MoparClassic - An emulator for an old java MMORPG


GitHub

Joe0/MoparClassic

MoparClassic - An emulator for an old java MMORPG

The bindings:

github.com

Joe0/MoparClassic/blob/master/GameServer/src/org/moparscape/msc/gs/service/DialogService.scala

package org.moparscape.msc.gs.service
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.{ Player, Npc }
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.dialog.NpcDialog
import java.util.concurrent.Executors
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.npchandler._

object DialogService {

	private var mapping = Map[Int, NpcDialog]()
	private val executor = Executors.newCachedThreadPool

	addMapping(125, new Aggie)
	addMapping(33, new Apothecary)
	addMapping(164, new BananaExchange)

	addMapping(Array(95, 224, 268, 485, 540, 617, 792), new Banker)
	
	addMapping(26, new Baraek)
	addMapping(142, new Barmaid)
	addMapping(176, new BrotherJered)
This file has been truncated. show original

github.com

Joe0/MoparClassic/blob/master/GameServer/src/org/moparscape/msc/gs/event/handler/objectaction/ObjectActionManager.scala

package org.moparscape.msc.gs.event.handler.objectaction

import scala.Array.canBuildFrom
import scala.collection.JavaConversions.seqAsJavaList
import scala.language.implicitConversions

import org.moparscape.msc.gs.event.handler.objectaction.impl._
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.definition.EntityHandler
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.definition.entity.GameObjectDef
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.event.ChainManager

class ObjectActionManager extends ChainManager[Int, ObjectActionChain, ObjectActionParam](new ObjectActionChain(new MembersObjectAction, new TelePoint, new DefaultObjectAction)) {

	override def fire(chainType : ObjectActionChain, param : ObjectActionParam) {
		chainType.trigger(param)
	}

	private implicit def values(l : List[(GameObjectDef, Int)]) : java.util.List[Int] = l.map(_._2)
	private implicit def eventToChain(o : ObjectEvent) = new ObjectActionChain(o)
	private implicit def int2List(i : Int) = List(i)
This file has been truncated. show original

Pretty much the only thing I don’t like about them is the way they’re bound… Though, using Scala in place of configuration files is something that is becoming increasingly more common and you can really see why in the ObjectActionManager.

Also, I think the owner of that repo isn’t pushing to Lothy’s repo because things aren’t ready. So, I really wouldn’t consider either system complete until he makes a pull request.

Read full topic

item.title: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
item.dc:creator: @Not_a_bot Not_a_bot
item.description:
@Not_a_bot wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:22, topic:478840”][quote author=Not_a_bot link=topic=597059.msg4207067#msg4207067 date=1359077545]

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=597059.msg4207062#msg4207062 date=1359076780]

[quote author=Not_a_bot link=topic=597059.msg4206966#msg4206966 date=1359068709]

ITT: Rodgerwilco implying he even understands how a plugin system works, let alone judge one.
[/quote]Implying you can’t get a really good ideal from the JavaDocs and how DQ does it…

It’s not a finished product, nor is it claiming to be one. Good assessment.
[/quote]Being finished or not has absolutely nothing to do with understanding how it works…

Its quite relevant. You’re implying the generalization of one’s understanding of an implementation based off incomplete documentation alone… (not just the general idea). If you still fail to comprehend this, I am sorry.
[/quote]The structure and documentation provided, along with knowing that the source is based off DQ is enough to determine if the plugin system itself is obsolete.

Again, I bring up the point of a cassette player… Knowing that someone is creating something that plays music, and does so only using cassettes is enough to determine that the music player is obsolete. It doesn’t matter if said person even started making it or not, you can still definitively say that it is obsolete.[/quote]

I don’t follow…you’re saying the DQ plugin system is obsolete yet there’s no actual plugin system in use on any other source at the moment…so how are we calling this “obsolete” (I assume based of time alone)? Yes I understand the meaning of obsolete, but in this field everything goes obsolete in a matter of time, so lets cut the semantics and get specific.

Anyway, so I quickly browsed the one on MoparClassic (I assume that’s the one you work on). Quickly browsing through, it doesn’t seem completely different to the one on DQ, in fact it just looks like a more organized version of it (feel free to point out if I’ve been looking at the wrong repository (https://github.com/Lothy/MoparClassic/tree/master/GameServer/src/org/moparscape/msc/gs/plugins)). I can also bet there’s not enough testing on it to warrant it even usable yet on production, at least with the DQ version is has been tested out (while not perfect, its usable). Please clarify.

Read full topic
item.source: Project RSC going open source need developers/help

item.title: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
item.dc:creator: @Wife_Beater Wife Beater
item.description:
@Wife_Beater wrote:

[quote=“KO9, post:1, topic:478840”]Like I posted here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,560693.msg4204289.html#msg4204289

Javadocs are here: http://www.projectrsc.com/doc/index.html source code will be published once I have spoken with pompano and had a chance to look if there is anything that needs urgently fixing or w/e and also obv between time spent on prs06

[quote author=KO9 link=topic=560693.msg4204289#msg4204289 date=1358680929]
P.S.: Cannot get on site yet as I need to reset my password in database and honestly I have not slept for 30+ hours I am tired will do it soon…

Here is the current situation.

As many of you are probably aware there are a ton of problems with this server/project. It didn’t really take off or go quite how any of us expected and this is really down to a number of things from developers leaving to core staff losing interest and being too busy with personal issues.

The_Berg (The Greens as you may already know) was developing and running the server up until now. He however PM’d me on IRC saying he no longer wants to run the server:

[08:39:46] are you root btw?
[08:39:49] <The_Berg> yep
[08:39:54] can you give me root details?
[08:39:57] or you not want me to have
[08:40:03] <The_Berg> i’ll give you the server tbh
[08:40:07] <The_Berg> im done running it
[08:40:08] <The_Berg> lol
[08:40:11] why
[08:40:14] dude
[08:40:15] no
[08:40:15] <The_Berg> ive killed it
[08:40:18] i can’t run the whole thing
[08:40:20] i can help you
[08:40:25] but not all of it sorry
[08:40:27] i don’t have time man
[08:40:33] let me run it with u
[08:40:42] <The_Berg> pompano and swo0osh still run it
[08:40:45] i will lead the project if u want
[08:40:47] yes
[08:40:47] obv
[08:40:49] <The_Berg> you three can split w/e profits
[08:40:53] <The_Berg> i dont want it anymore
[08:40:59] will you stay dev?
[08:41:00] head dev
[08:41:01] <The_Berg> its not worth the stress and time
[08:41:03] or?
[08:41:22] <The_Berg> i’ll admit
[08:41:26] <The_Berg> you’re one hell of an admin

The convo goes on but I tried my best to keep The Berg on board but he really felt his time with the project was up.

I know that I may know have done the best job last time I was running the project however there are also some issues behind like such as issues between staff members and to be blunt I found it hard to command respect and actually have people do what I ask and be informed and kept in the loop about everything. To put it shortly, I didn’t feel I was in control or running the project at all.

I am now basically in full control of the project and will just run it how I think is best for the community and server in general. Basically my end goal and vision is to have RSC fully replicated and completed within 6 months! I know that this seems optimistic and I know that this community has seen it and heard it all before about big projects that are going to be amazing and do so much development yet nothing ever comes of it. You guys know me, you guys know my history you may or may not know the work I have done on PRS06 so far in the little time I have had to do it (http://projectrs06.com/) check it out I have been working 18-50 hour days (not shitting to you).

There are a lot of developers asking me to help on projectrs06 and tbh we have a full core dev team and an overflow of devs to work on our open source software (nova, join #prs06code on rizon if interested). I think it would be best for the server, community and everyone (bar maybe rival servers, sorry, maybe we can talk merge or something?) in general if PRSC went fully open source. This includes data files (NOT PLAYER DATA), npc spawns, drop data etc and FULL server source code available to anyone who wants it via a public repo to do as they want. I will add contribs who want to work on the project. I don’t care who you are, our history or shit if you have the knowledge, motivation and maturity to work on this project then come by #projectcode on rizon (this will be new prsc public dev chan).

I will be making some changes to the server in the up coming days/weeks as dev team grows (hopefully) and work is done. Give me some time though guys I am very busy with PRS06 right now and have to split time. Great things will come I hope and at the end I really really hope this community ends up with a completed fully working RSC source that I can leave as my legacy.
[/quote][/quote]

is this open source yet?

Read full topic

item.title: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
item.dc:creator: @q3ase q3ase
item.description:
@q3ase wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:28, topic:478840”][quote author=q3ase link=topic=597059.msg4207765#msg4207765 date=1359164334]
I like how you’ve actually got ridden of the packethandler.xml and had it hardcoded into the server.

Be so much simpler to write a script auto generate new integer values for the packets then write a simpler script client side. Have an auto updating client every 12 hours regenerate packet ids recompile client update webclient and automatic download of the external client to stop bots.
[/quote]How would that stop bots? They’d be hooking methods, not constructing packets from scratch…[/quote]Most bots actual do hook the methods like

createpacket(ID)
addInt(Etc)
So on so on, not actual hook the methods what invoke them. Kids just retarded in that way.

Read full topic

item.title: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Arsonist:

And no one has given me tips on what still needs doing?

Probably the question should be who can do it and is still motivated to do it, and looks like hiring developers like Pompano did, doesn’t works either.

Anyway you could try getting your data formatted in the joe0 dialogue system since he seems to be the only one left that is still interested in dev msc.

GitHub

Joe0/MoparClassic

MoparClassic - An emulator for an old java MMORPG

here is an example of something i did (not accurate )

[code=Scala]package org.moparscape.msc.gs.npchandler
import org.moparscape.msc.gs.model.dialog.NpcDialog

class Klarense extends NpcDialog {

override def init {
	if (qstage >= 2 && boughtShip != 1) {
		this + option1
		this + option2
		this + option3
		this + option4
	}
	else {
		this + option1
		this + option2
		this + option3
	}
}

override def begin {
	if (qstage == 0 || qstage == 4) {
		if (fixedShip2 != 1) {
			this > "Oh it's you, I thought you were dead"; breath
			this > "It wasn't easy but I got the lady back"; breath
			this > "if you want to sail you'll have to fix it all over again";
		}
		else {
			this < "Hello there"; breath
			this > "Good to see you made your trip back safe!"
		}
		exit
	}
	else if (boughtShip == 1) {
		this < "Hey how can I sail in this ship?"; breath
		this > "first you should fix the ship damage if you haven't already"; breath
		this > "to fix her up you will need some wooden planks"; breath
		this > "and hammer them over with steel nails"; breath
		this < "then could you take me to crandor isle when it's ready?"; breath
		this > "don't count on it, but you can try asking somebody else"; breath
		this > "I've heard there is on old sailor living in draynor village"; breath
		this > "you might have better luck with him though"; breath
		exit
	}
	else {
		this > "You're interested in a trip on the lumbridge lady are you?"; breath
		this > "I admit she looks fine, but she isn't seaworthy right now"; breath
		end
	}
}

lazy val option1 = new RespondEnd("Do you know when she will be seaworthy?",
		Array("No not really",
		"Port Sarim's shipbuilders aren't very efficient",
		"So it could be quite a while"), npc, player)

lazy val option2 = new GenericEnd("Ah well, nevermind", npc, player)

lazy val option3 = new RespondEnd("Would you take me to crandor isle when it's ready?",
		Array("Well even if I know how to get there",
		"I wouldn't like to risk it",
		"Especially after going to all the effort of fixing the old girl up"), npc, player)
		
lazy val option4 = new GenericEnd("Can I buy this ship?", npc, player) {
	override def begin {
		breath
		this > "Hmm maybe you'll be able to fix her up"; breath
		this > "Alright I will sell her to you for 2000 gold"; breath
		end
	}
	
	this + new GenericEnd("ok I'll buy the ship", npc, player) {
		override def begin {
			breath
			if (player.getInventory.remove(10, 2000)) {
				this >> "You hand the gold to Klarense"; pause(1000)
				player.getActionSender.sendInventory
				this > "Then its all yours, take good care of it"; breath
				this > "to fix her up you will need some wooden planks"; breath
				this > "and hammer them over with steel nails"; breath
				this < "then could you take me to crandor isle when it's ready?"; breath
				this > "don't count on it, but you can try asking somebody else"; breath
				this > "I've heard there is on old sailor living in draynor village"; breath
				this > "you might have better luck with him though"; breath
				player.setQuestStage(1601, 1, true)
			}
			else {
				this > "Looks like you don't have enough gold"; breath
			}
			exit
		}
	}
	
	this + new GenericEnd("I don't think I have that much", npc, player)
	
}

lazy val boughtShip = player.getQuestStage(1601)

lazy val fixedShip2 = player.getQuestStage(1604)

lazy val qstage = player.getQuestStage(16)

}
[/code]

Read full topic

item.description:
@Arsonist wrote:

JUMPHIM:

why has rsc development be come whose peniss bigger then the other this is getting bad how old are we lets stop this and just get a long its been years and all we do is argue

I agree, I hate to say it but this has to be the worst online community I’ve ever been involved with in my life due to the constant arguing!

And no one has given me tips on what still needs doing?

Read full topic

item.title: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
item.dc:creator: @JUMPHIM JUMPHIM
item.description:
@JUMPHIM wrote:

why has rsc development be come whose cocks bigger then the other this is getting bad how old are we lets stop this and just get a long its been years and all we do is argue

item.source: Project RSC going open source need developers/help

item.title: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Not_a_bot, post:20, topic:478840”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=597059.msg4207062#msg4207062 date=1359076780]

[quote author=Not_a_bot link=topic=597059.msg4206966#msg4206966 date=1359068709]

ITT: Rodgerwilco implying he even understands how a plugin system works, let alone judge one.
[/quote]Implying you can’t get a really good ideal from the JavaDocs and how DQ does it…

It’s not a finished product, nor is it claiming to be one. Good assessment.
[/quote]Being finished or not has absolutely nothing to do with understanding how it works…

Its quite relevant. You’re implying the generalization of one’s understanding of an implementation based off incomplete documentation alone… (not just the general idea). If you still fail to comprehend this, I am sorry.[/quote]The structure and documentation provided, along with knowing that the source is based off DQ is enough to determine if the plugin system itself is obsolete.

Again, I bring up the point of a cassette player… Knowing that someone is creating something that plays music, and does so only using cassettes is enough to determine that the music player is obsolete. It doesn’t matter if said person even started making it or not, you can still definitively say that it is obsolete.

Read full topic
item.source: Project RSC going open source need developers/help

item.title: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Not_a_bot:

ITT: Rodgerwilco implying he even understands how a plugin system works, let alone judge one.

Hi Not_a_bot, I was under the impression you already knew about a plugin systems architecture and familiar with the programming language Java. If you need to know anything you can start by viewing Yongs tutorials and if you can’t figure out the basics CFF and I will be more than willing to send you to the search bar. Once you figure it out then we can move on to talking about plugin systems; how they are designed, why they are designed that way and the best way for you to implement one into your own localhost server.

Cheers!

Read full topic
item.source: Project RSC going open source need developers/help

Its quite relevant. You’re implying the generalization of one’s understanding of an implementation based off incomplete documentation alone… (not just the general idea). If you still fail to comprehend this, I am sorry.

item.title: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“waj, post:14, topic:478840”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=597059.msg4206437#msg4206437 date=1358987850]

What can I do as a programming-illiterate passionate supporter of an RSC replica?

I’ve got a shit ton of fail rates for most skills now so that seems pretty much under control, what about quests? I’ve got a few quests written in NpcTalk(""); format - does that format help with the project?

Seems to me that they are using an outdated plugin system from 2012. I would suggest learning their syntax.
[/quote]

Oh man 2012 was 10 years back and its real outdated now…[/quote]Something can be outdated before it’s even released… It’d be like making a brand new cassette player; it’s outdated no matter how you look at it.

Read full topic
item.source: Project RSC going open source need developers/help
